block.p: Susan Ann Ubhaus, the daughter of Eleanor and John C. Ubhaus of Edison, N.J., is to be married this evening in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., to Marcus Alan Motroni, the son of Myra and Hector J. Motroni of Westport, Conn. The Rev. Francis Maione, a Roman Catholic priest, is to officiate at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton, with Rabbi Shimon L. Berris taking part.

The bride, 30, graduated from Rutgers University. Until last month, she was an admissions assistant at the Tuck School of Business Administration at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. Her father is a partner in Waller-Sutton Media Partners, an investment company in New York. Her mother is the secretary of the Edison Board of Education.

Susan Ann Ubhaus, the daughter of Eleanor and John C. Ubhaus of Edison, N.J., is to be married this evening in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., to Marcus Alan Motroni, the son of Myra and Hector J. Motroni of Westport, Conn. The Rev. Francis Maione, a Roman Catholic priest, is to officiate at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton, with Rabbi Shimon L. Berris taking part.

The bride, 30, graduated from Rutgers University. Until last month, she was an admissions assistant at the Tuck School of Business Administration at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. Her father is a partner in Waller-Sutton Media Partners, an investment company in New York. Her mother is the secretary of the Edison Board of Education.

The bridegroom, 27, graduated from Dartmouth and received an M.B.A. from the Tuck School last month. Later this month, he is to become an investment banking associate at CS First Boston in New York. His father is a senior vice president and the chief of staff at Xerox in Stamford, Conn. His mother teaches the fifth grade at the Weston (Conn.) Middle School.
